item.title: ICTC 3104.3 Data Analytics and Big Data
item.description: 👉 Help - Install R and R studio Introduction and Basics of R Programming 📚 Slides 💻 Lab-work - slides 🔖 Cheat sheet Data Import and Data Wrangling with R 📚 Slides 💻 Lab-work - slides 🔖 Cheat sheet Data Visualisation with R 📚 Slides 💻 Lab-work - slides 🔖 Cheat sheet - 1 Cheat sheet - 2 Individual assignment Details here

📚 Slide 1: Introduction to regression analysis 📚 Slide 2: Simple Linear Regression Tutorial 1 📚 Slide 3: Simple Linear Regression 📚 Slide 4: Simple Linear Regression 📚 Basics of R Programming 📚 Regression Analysis with R house.csv Tutorial 2 Other software heart.data.csv 📚 Multiple Linear Regression 📚 ANOVA 📚 Confidence Intervals in Multiple Regression 📚 Transformations to Correct Model Inadequacies 📚 Identifying Outliers and Influential Cases 📚 Indicator Variables 📚 Indicator Variables (cont) and Variable Selection real-estate data source: http://www.

Download and Install R and R Studio R and RStudio Download R Download RStudio The first thing you need to do to get started with R is to install it on your computer. R works on pretty much every platform available, including the widely available Windows, Mac OS X, and Linux systems. If you want to watch a step-by-step tutorial on how to install R for Mac or Windows, you can watch these videos:
